alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 2:23PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fremont, east central Custer and west central Pueblo Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 223 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southeastern Junkins Burn Scar, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Fremont, east central Custer and west central Pueblo Counties, including the following locations... Beulah and Wetmore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for southeastern Colorado.
